head.title: Holiday Forecast: Cool to Sultry, and a Chance of CD Flurries

identified-content.classifier: Top/Classifieds/Job Market/Job Categories/Music, Theater and Dance

hedline.hl1: Holiday Forecast: Cool to Sultry, and a Chance of CD Flurries

abstract.p: Pop and jazz critics of The New York Times comment on this year's most notable holiday albums, along with selection of hits, compilation and re-issue albums; drawing (S)

block.p: GLOBAL warming has no effect on the blizzard of Christmas albums, which starts with preliminary flurries as early as August and September and blankets the market in October and November. Sooner or later, it seems, every musician is tempted to remake the seasonal staples, while a few more adventurous ones come up with new songs to address holiday feelings from coziness to desolation. At the same time, greatest-hits albums, quickie live recordings, reissues and compilations turn up to tempt holiday shoppers. Here, pop and jazz critics of The New York Times comment on this year's most notable holiday albums, along with a selection of hits, compilation and reissue albums. (Prices for the CD's range from $7.97 to $18.99.)

Sooner or later, it seems, every musician is tempted to remake the seasonal staples, while a few more adventurous ones come up with new songs to address holiday feelings from coziness to desolation. At the same time, greatest-hits albums, quickie live recordings, reissues and compilations turn up to tempt holiday shoppers. Here, pop and jazz critics of The New York Times comment on this year's most notable holiday albums, along with a selection of hits, compilation and reissue albums. (Prices for the CD's range from $7.97 to $18.99.)
